available_mods: notice: some of these mods are out of date

available_mods.name: Tobi
available_mods.desc: Enable busting. Once anyone's points is reduced below zero, the game ends.

available_mods.name: Agarirenchan
available_mods.desc: A round repeats if the dealer wins.

available_mods.name: Tenpairenchan
available_mods.desc: A round repeats if the dealer is tenpai at draw.

available_mods.name: Agariyame
available_mods.desc: All Last doesn't repeat if the dealer is first place and wins.

available_mods.name: Tenpaiyame
available_mods.desc: All Last doesn't repeat if the dealer is in first place and is tenpai at draw.

available_mods.name: Tonpuu
available_mods.desc: Limit the game to the East round only.

available_mods.name: Kuitan Nashi
available_mods.desc: Disallow open tanyao.

available_mods.name: Kuikae Nashi
available_mods.desc: Disallow swap-calling.

available_mods.name: Kiriage Mangan
available_mods.desc: 3 han 60 fu and 4 han 30 fu are worth mangan.

available_mods.name: Head Bump
available_mods.desc: Enable head bump. In case of multiple ron, only the person closest in turn order gets the win.

available_mods.name: Open Riichi
available_mods.desc: You have the option to declare open riichi, which is worth 2 han but reveals your hand to the table.

available_mods.name: Sekinin Barai
available_mods.desc: If you deal the last dragon called for a daisangen hand, or the last wind called for a daisuushii hand, you are responsible for the yakuman payment if they tsumo, or half of the payment if they ron off someone else.

available_mods.name: No Kazoe Yakuman
available_mods.desc: Disable kazoe yakuman. 13+ han is worth sanbaiman.

available_mods.name: No Double Yakuman
available_mods.desc: Disable double yakuman. Yakuman still stacks, but each yaku that typically awards double yakuman only awards one stack of yakuman.

available_mods.name: Wareme
available_mods.desc: In each round, the player whose wall is broken is given the wareme marker. If the wareme player wins, they are paid double the amount of points. If the wareme player has to pay points, they pay double the amount of points. Riichi sticks and honba payments are not affected.

available_mods.name: Aotenjou
available_mods.desc: Removes limit hands. Score grows exponentially with han according to the formula 4 * fu * 2^(2+han). Not recommended with tobi enabled.

available_mods.name: Sanchahou
available_mods.desc: Enable triple ron abortive draw.

available_mods.name: Persistent Cards
available_mods.desc: The character card you choose at the beginning is your card for the whole game.

available_mods.name: Two Saki Cards
available_mods.desc: You draft two character cards instead of one. This mode is unsupported by the developers of Sakicards, but let's see what happens.

available_mods.name: Show Waits
available_mods.desc: Add some UI that shows waits.

available_mods.name: Open Hands
available_mods.desc: Everyone plays with tiles shown.

available_mods.name: Ten
available_mods.desc: Adds 10m, 10p, and 10s. Changes dora accordingly (if dora is enabled). Tanyao now allows nines, and chanta/junchan/honroutou require tens instead. 13 Orphans now requires the ten instead of the nine of each suit. Ittsu is unchanged.

available_mods.name: Star Suit (beta)
available_mods.desc: Adds a fourth suit (stars). This suit does not form yaku. This mod is in beta because we should probably write some yaku for it.

available_mods.name: Space Mahjong
available_mods.desc: Sequences can wrap (891, 912). Winds and dragons can make sequences. You can chii from any direction. Chiitoitsu is disabled. Open kokushi is allowed and worth 3 han.

available_mods.name: Galaxy Mahjong
available_mods.desc: Replaces one of each tile with a blue 'galaxy' tile that acts as a wildcard of its number. For example, galaxy 3s can be used as 3m, 3p, or 3s. Galaxy winds are wind wildcards, and galaxy dragons are dragon wildcards.

available_mods.name: Fifth Tile
available_mods.desc: Adds a fifth copy of every standard tile.

available_mods.name: No Honors
available_mods.desc: Removes the honor tiles (winds and dragons) from the game.

available_mods.name: Shiro Pocchi
available_mods.desc: One of the white dragons is shiro pocchi. Shiro pocchi acts a joker tile when drawn while in riichi.

available_mods.name: Golden Chun
available_mods.desc: One of each dragon tile is a special tile. The special white dragon is shiro pocchi, which acts a joker tile when drawn while in riichi. The special green dragon is an aka dora. The special red dragon is the golden chun, which acts as a joker for any five, and grants 1 han when used as a five. Completing a hand via shiro pocchi while using the golden chun as a five and having the aka green dragon scores yakuman.

available_mods.name: Blue Dragon (beta)
available_mods.desc: Adds the Chinese blue-framed white dragon as a fourth dragon tile (hakuban). Yaku treats it as an honor tile. Shousangen is reduced to 1 han (+2 from dragons) and Daisangen is reduced to 2 han (+3 from dragons). Adds Shousuugen (3 dragons + dragon pair) as yakuman and Daisuugen (4 dragons) as double yakuman. This mod is in beta because pao is not yet implemented for blue dragon.

available_mods.name: Shouhai
available_mods.desc: Reduces tiles in hand from 13 to 12. The goal is to achieve a tenpai hand rather than a winning hand. The idea is that your 13th tile is replaced with an invisible 'joker' tile that can be used to complete any hand.

available_mods.name: Chinitsu
available_mods.desc: Replace the wall with 16 copies of each bamboo tile. Includes 10s if Ten is enabled.

available_mods.name: Calls Are Forced
available_mods.desc: Forces you to make all available calls, including riichi. You still get to choose if multiple calls are available.
